twitch_info.title: I wanna Gaze at the Horizon - Any-Penalties% - 5:58:20.55 - Clear!!!
twitch_info.description: I finally cleared a run of Horizon, not expected at all.

message.body: much better run than last night so far
why put a trick jump like this in a puzzle tho
At least it's the only hard one of stage 2
can the run not die here
sub 3 hour stage 6 is a new one
You can beat that by a large amount :o
That noeg ave me b ad rng
Yeah you need to be lucky once in the last turns
oh cmon that one was free
stage 8 boss and final are the ones to worry about
back to my images now tho
Yeah it's a bit too much
Stage 8 needs more "fangame skill" than stage 7 except maybe for the last screens
Fortunately the music is pretty chill
Stage 8 never ends, just like its boss
And there are no hints monkaS
the game breaks at stage 8 boss
I have to reboot the game
It was not meant to be done in one sitting
worst part is it's also mini puzzle
You need to manage your orange and red keys
Do you *have* to do any diamonds if you were to nail all the gates?
The corner spam is a bit shorter isn't it? So it's manageable
It's shorter route wise for corenr spam ye
Did it first try in my last run
But my last run was far, far worse
I was like 4 hours 20 minutes by this point
The game is brutal after all
I even attempt to do the jump as well
That fall is so satisfying at the end
It's a bit of a shame that the penalties rooms aren't different rooms for the last stages
I always have trouble in penalty
stage 6 one is final but buffed
is a nerfed version of screen 3
Still 3 minutes to go for a sub 1 hour split
had tos tretch my legs etc
Of course it's a long run
to reachf inal boss in a speedrun
It's all good it was a the start
You were doing the first screens without? You madman
This is an extremely good run btw
Only other person who rtuns this game is Nick24
and only up to stage 6 boss
I'm probably the only ne crazy enough anyway
I guess up to stage 6 is safer as a run anyway
If it's a fun run I suppose it's not a problem if you're the only runner
Horizon is a great game imp
I haven't played to be fair but as a viewer I think it's interesting, albeit really difficult
Yeah, it's really fun to watch
Woud not recommend clearing this game
The bosses are great to watch
Whether Ican win is completely dependent on said rng
It would be fine with a checkpoint or something
oh I screwed up gg xd
final boss is only bad cause no saves
Cut it right in the middle
But yeah you need to be lucky with the random jump, the boss 6 and 8 attacks, and the rest is execution-heavy or plain RNG
>why did you make me do a fucking CRESCENT
and so is a trophy jump
What even is a trophy jump
spikes in the shape of a trophy
There are some questionnable jumps and timing in this stage
This is my best run yet
I hope to clear final boss
I had to learn that ending because
You have to do that scuffed double jump there and back if you don't do that trick I pulled.
The warning is so menacing too
it makes you jump every time
At least it does for me
If you blow up in the game you blow up in real life
holy shit a run to final boss?
there is a danger I might not clear
The final boss is really hard
and did you see that slow transition?
The game lags if you don't restart?
Wouldn't that help for the boss?
the only thing that lags is transitions
a whole 5 seconds longer to try t he boss every time
This is stage 8 boss we're talking about
plus the lag might affect final boss
The ones that cut half squares are brutal
The real puzzle was needle all along
welcome to the second run in history
The tas did not include stages 6-8
Stage 6 TAS must not be interesting except for the inverts
Yeah and stage 7 ain't interesting to tas either
Stage 8 would be really interesting to tas
So I do the 9 minute skip instead
But this is now another run to final boss so
Definitely not worth it unless you're a needle god
If you're a needle god then this section is fine
And would be faster than waiting
if you're not then don't bother
TAS did not include penalties and neither did Nick24's run
I also SMASHED his run today
So I can say this is a good run even if I don't clear. xD
At least one record out of it
Yeah you need to know the timing
I have lots of praxctice as well
That doesn't sound like a good time xD
you can tell I stayed up alte for this boss lmao
I have a notepad methodf for stage 6 attac
really bad rng at the end there
honestly this is a fun speedrun
I have roughly 3 hours to clear tonight
Hopefully it will be done by then
one of them is Rukito jump
But any run can clear so
FIRST RUN to clear not by TAS
first run to include all penalties
first run to include all stages
The time looks great too, sub 6 hours
Sub 6 hours is insanely hard to get
My second clear of this game btw!
I've done tons of runs to different stages
I love this ending as well
It's truly the best fangame eding I've seen.
And the best part isn'te ven shown yet
That's right at the very end
The ending with the kid gazing at the horizon is great
The game actually lives up to its title.
Unfortunate that the last boss is so hard
The final boss is by far the hardest part of the game.
And given this game is so long.
At least when you know the solutions I guess
a birt more than that actually
Puzzle-wise the last Stage 6 or 8 puzzle must be the worst
The sprites for the bosses are great too, and they actually are animated
Necoroneko is a very talented maker
And the guide is way too detailed
This ending makes me sad every time, but in a good way lmao
It has no business being this cute
Usually games that are that hard have a different atmosphere at the end
That was a surprisingly low amount of retries too
I did actually retry onc emore but I did't count it
as I was fixing the game
I did NOT expect a clear
considering how long this game is
You could still try to grind it more if you wanted, but how lucky would you have to be to beat that
Well, there's a chance I could
Get a 5 hour 30 minute clear reasonably
But the luck is the big issue yeah.
Yeah it's really good on top on being the first run
It's really nice to have an actual run of this game though
That's partly why I did it actually.
I also did it for one other reason.
I optimised the strats of each screen really far.
And I want people to see that
REALLY wanted there to be a run
Some of the strats in stage 8 were great for example I can see that
most of them I used help of Goron's videos for stage 8.
The keypick strats without having to do inverts are great too
For the first 3-4 screens were all me on stage 8
I did the first proper screen of keypick without help
But the rest I did some looking
Reason being is they take too long to grind.
I can figure them out (I've cleared Keypick 100 and am on extra 5)
But I decied it was not worth it
At the end you have to travel from one end of the screen to another
So I found some Chinese playthrough
Someone who actually optimised every screen in stage 7 for the keypick segments
The strat for corner spam is my own I think
It's a combination of Goran and the Chinese player
I did all of stages 1-6 without help
I already said it but the fall at the end? Super neat
I took the idea from the other two players
But they had a method that was kind-of scuffed iirc
They implemented the drop either later or earlier
With your strat you need 2 corners I think? The first jump and the last
3 if you included the first two required
Yeah my strat uses minimal corners
That makes it the best strat
However, if you get through a corner it's even easier in the ending
Basically one blue corner if done correctly (light blue) you can reach the green key without some awkward jump hop
Since you can afford to waste a key
But it's perfectly doable with the awkward jump hop as well
I think I see which one you mean
It hasn't quite settled in the fact I cleared yet
You did grind the run a lot so it's deserved
Yeah, I grinded for 9 hours yesterday
3 of it was on the final boss roughly
I also grinded this game near daily for a while
I kept pushing the boundaries until I finally became capable of doing it
And honestly that was an extremely clean run
The first 6 stages were so optimised its unbelievable
I failed a couple times but
Cause every time you die it's go round and around again
and you do this circling like
And the final way around is full of choke jumps
That explains the time save compared to the other run
Yeah, I saved lots of time there.
I also saved lots of time generally, as my deaths were far and few between for time wasting.
Most of my deaths were small ones
Though I did suffer badly on the stage 6 pre-final screen for no reason
Even though my stage 6 was otherwise really good
But man, my first run to save onto my splits
You must have lost 5 minutes tops
wait really, I was that fast? holy
That's my fastest stage 6 yet then
You didn't mess up any screen before the gates
Though on stage 7 I did mess up like once iirc
I still can't believe I memorised the 1st screen of stage 7
The one with the mini spikes I think?
yep that's the pre-final stage 6 screen
I don't remember many chokes on stage 8
But it's 1:22 it seems a bit long
Yeah, there were a couple chokes on stage 8
Maybe you could shave off some time here
Since every single choke costs a ton of time.
As every single block has a set speed.
I also did too many fails on pre-final screen as well
I made up for all that time
Because I cleared final screen twice
Stage 8 boss is pretty much perfect too
Second try, won't beat that anytime soon
Yeah, that was pretty much the most perfect run you can get on that boss.
And final boss was final boss
So even 5:30 would need to be a really good run
It's really unlikely to beat this run's time actually.
It would take a lot of practice, and a lot of praying.,
Well there is time to save, especially on the final boss, but that might be grindy
I could definitely have cleared the boss early
Problem is it's such a long run that stage 8 boss attacks become hard to read.
And since you're given like no time to adjust, it's pretty brutal
And the constant flipping doesn't help either
I think you got to the Stage 8 attack four times
I was getting to stage 8 attack every time the rng let me reach stage 6 portion
With good RNG a 10 minutes final boss is doable
I think I only failed the stage 6 portion once?
Guess what my notepad strat is?
I don't remember a fail actually, but that was a long fight I might have forgotten
Do you focus on the middle row maybe?
So, since I'm a fast typer.
Since the middle row is t he key.
It's the only one that matters in every configuration.
But, for the notepad strat, I write down safe spots as 'o' and danger spots as 'x'.
I write down all 3 positions for all 6 times.
Yeah, so I look at the corresponding column on the notepad for which row to focus on
for which section of the row*
And then I just do it from there :D
That should even would for regular boss 6 wouldn't it?
it would work in all configuratios for them as well
Which means you could maybe first try it everytime
As there are 4 difficult attacks and 3 hints
But yeah, 3 hints makes it speedrun viable.
The only reason I knew a run could be done was because of those 3 hints.
It's 12 attacks long or something xD
Is it even doable without the hints?
1.0 version had no hints at all
The last one is like 15 moves long
It is doable without hints, but
I use hints because that's how the boss should be played imo
You can't even practice as you can with boss 8
You would either need to be able to memorize 15 moves in a row or pray
You can tell the dev considers it a genuine mechanic to the game because in v1.03 (my version), you have 3 circles from stage 8 to indicate the 3 hints.
In older versions you only had 2 hints and no display
So you had to remember how many hints you had lmao
In my version, 3 hints were introduced as the standard from then on.
I don't play the recent v1.04 because they nerfed the chainsaw attack of stage 5 boss.
That's the only thng v1.04 nrfed iirc
Other than the slimes appearing in stage 7 keypick screens
They removed those in v1.04 as well
v1.03 is basically v1.00 but hints for stage 6 boss
They don't really have a purpose
But I don't want to lose the challenge of stage 5 boss either.
So I bit the bullet there lmao
Plus in the grand scheme the slimes don't even waste that much time.
Negligible compared to the run anyway.
So I don't feel like it's so bad I need v1.04.
It's great that Necoroneko made those changes
Honestly, all his games are great.
I haven't played SlimePark yet though.
He made the changes quickly too when the players requested them
Reason people wanting stage 5 boss chainsaw puzzle nerf was because it was a huge barrier to learn in the fight.
Can't say if it's easier than Horizon
And it's in the middle/end of it too
All the other games are easier than Horizon.
Yeah, puzzles-wise it might be on par with Horizon, that game.
Wasn't extra reusing screens from Horizon?
That's why Keypick 100 extra is disgusting XD
That said I did the first 4 myself without issue
It's the 5th one that's basically impossible.
It needs to have a little challenge in it
Well, they are all challenging - most people get super stuck
Just I'm not exactly bad at the puzzles apparently. XD
I guess finishing Horizon is a good sign :)
Horizon has only been cleared by 7 people excluding Tas and including myself
Nah, according to me looking at delfruit ,bilibili, niconico, youtube ad I wanna community Discord.
Strangely no Japanese players have seemingly cleared the game.
We've had a couple chinese tho
Mostt people think you have to do inverts for stage 7.
With its reputation you'd think more people would have cleared it
And not only that, stage 8 is hard and stage 8 boss is yeah
There's at least two people who quit on final boss as well
I read that in Kurath's review
Yeah, that's where I found out.
Well, we've certainly made history today. :D
Fortunately the ending is shared through those seven playthroughs
As you can tell with my third save file at final boss.
You can tell I really have been trying with this game xd
The amount of deaths in the first file though
I was stupidly dedicated to finishing this game.
I quit in 2018 because I had to do inverts for stage 6
And then this year I saw it and decided
If it weren't for that upload.
We wouldn't be here now XD
I believe I have the name in the dedscription of my all bosses video
Fun-fact btw. It was because of speedrunning this game that I revitalised why I loved it.
When I returned to it I just wanted the clear.
I played the game through again and went "wait, I wanted to speedrun this game!"
Remembered all the reasons that made me get here in the first place.
I forgot all of the guide information I used back then.
So I actually did stages 1-6 all on my own to redeem myself.
I did need to quickly check a guide due to an unexplained mechanic in one stage 2 screen.
But I had already fiured out the whole solution myself.
So I was okay with that
Guides are here to be used
But only when they need to be.
And obvs I had the delfruit review and arzztt help me with the stage 9 skip
I found out some really interesting things due to that skip btw
You know that spike in that room?
You tried the leehe jump? monkaS
But you know the spike in that one room when you teleport?
I thought that spike would be a trap
If you shoot that spike, you actually get a whole cutscene
You get that same death screen if you shoot a spike a third time in the third screen (the one you do the skip on).
Has its own sound effect as well
I love those details in Necoroneko's games
Shooting t hat spike btw has a bug as well.
The red effects that can kill you stay
At least some of them do
Isn't it the one you get in Slimetrap as well?
I cleared SlimeTrap on Mad difficulty btw
Oh that's a good shout actually.
I never beaten the mad difficulty boss for this game
and I called my video all bosses
Just getting to the boss is hard enough
I did it quite a few times
I should actually grind them a little as bonus
re-stream real quick then, so I can highlight the main run later
